body: This is odd. 'ix' has only been removed in pandas 1.0.0, so reverting to earlier pandas versions should work. Could you double check your pandas version? I also think that the command takes only an equal sign: `conda install pandas=0.25.1`

< pandas 1 should work, but we also just fixed this in the code @AlexEMG - but it's likely not in the pypi release yet (one would have to install from github source right now). But, in short, this will go away in the next pypi update :)
I did test backwards compatibility with pandas 0.23 or so. What version do you have?

I reinstalled Anaconda3 and DeepLabCut from github source. Then I updated pandas, but I still get the same error message when I try to extract outlier frames. My pandas version is 1.0.1. I am a little bit frustrated. DeepLabCut would safe me a lot of time analyzing my data :(

I am confused too; as looking at your code error, it is using this function:
`\deeplabcut\refine_training_dataset\outlier_frame_extraction_toolbox.py`

it is looking at line # 322

`322         DF = self.Dataframe.ix[[self.currFrame]]` 

where this is an `.ix`, which is supported in pre-pandas 1, i.e you need to install `pip install pandas==0.25`. BUT, we fixed this already in the latest update. i.e. this does not exist in the current code:

https://github.com/AlexEMG/DeepLabCut/blob/7bd99207f9dfdb6f33625a4c557b0872fef3dd66/deeplabcut/refine_training_dataset/outlier_frame_extraction_toolbox.py#L322

So, you must be using an older version of deeplabcut, but then updating pandas, which would not work.

So, the solution is as follows:

(1) install the base code by:

`git clone https://github.com/AlexEMG/DeepLabCut`

cd into DeepLabCut 

Then run:
```
import deeplabcut

deeplabcut.__version__

deeplabcut.__file__ 
```

OR (2) install deeplabcut, and DO not upgrade pandas. You need to be sure an older version is installed. to check this:
```
import pandas
pandas.__version__
```

First I tried step 1 as you described it. DeepLabCut version was 2.1.6.2 and pandas 1.0.1. Interestingly I still got the same error code.
![DeepLabCut2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/61821473/76115539-a005af80-5fe8-11ea-8dd8-c13305a0ad7d.JPG)
Then I downgraded pandas to version 0.25.1 and checked the installed version with the command "conda list". I still get this error message. I am also confused. This seems illogical to me. I just don't know what I'm doing wrong.

can you please post the output of: 

```
import pandas
pandas.__version__
```

I tried again to install pandas 0.25.1. The same way as I did before and it is WORKING :) I don't know why it didn't work the first time. You can't imagine how happy I am. Thank you for your help and your rapid answers. DeepLabCut is such a great software and saves so much time in data analysis. Thank you for offering it as an open source software :)
I had same issue. it seems I am using the latest version of DLP and pandas. What is the solution except downgrade pandas.

xcccc402, the first part of this answer from @MMathisLab should help you:
> So, the solution is as follows:
> 
> (1) install the base code by:
> 
> `git clone https://github.com/AlexEMG/DeepLabCut`
> 
> cd into DeepLabCut
> 
> Then run:
> 
> ```
> import deeplabcut
> 
> deeplabcut.__version__
> 
> deeplabcut.__file__ 
> ```
Also deeplabcut was just updated last night, so you should be able to just run `pip install deeplabcut==2.1.6.3`
Either try .iloc[] instead of using .ix[] which is deprecated or Do conda install pandas==0.25.1
Use data.iloc() instead of data.ix() ---- > package is updated
